The record in the Treatise of Invertebrate Paleontology (Part U; Spencer & Wright 1966 ) of a benthopectinid from the “Albian of England ” is based on an arm fragment from the Albian Red Chalk of Yorkshire, United Kingdom (C.W. Wright, pers. comm. to ASG, 1978). We have examined this specimen (NHMUK PI EE 17997), which comprises five marginal ossicles reconstructed on plasticene. The shape of the ossicles indicates that this specimen belongs to the genus
Chrispaulia
; it is here described as a new species,
C. wrightorum
sp. nov. (see below). In addition, we record another species from the Hauterivian (Lower Cretaceous) of northeast England and northern Germany .
